issues.description: The problem description (Part 2) specifies messageOnMilk(double milkVolume), but both the UML in the problem statement and the reference solution define messageOnMilk() with no parameters. This mismatch will confuse students about the correct interface method signature and prevent code from compiling if they follow one part of the spec over the other.
issues.suggested_fix: Unify the signature: either remove the double parameter from the Part 2 description (and update the text to messageOnMilk()) or update the UML, template, and solution to declare messageOnMilk(double milkVolume) and adjust implementations to include the volume in the return string.

issues.description: The template stub for singFarmSongVerse in Farm.java omits the Animal parameter (it is commented out), but the UML and reference solution expect singFarmSongVerse(Animal animal). Without the parameter, students cannot implement verse printing correctly.
issues.suggested_fix: Modify the template method signature to accept an Animal parameter: change private void singFarmSongVerse(/*Animal animal*/) to private void singFarmSongVerse(Animal animal), and adjust the method body and calls accordingly.
